title: Ask HN: How to build a loyal audience that pays?
text:
I have developed more than 600 products. But since I don't have a paying loyal audience, I've been constantly starting over to brand.

Then I thought of branding myself and started to produce content on the area I wanted to focus on. I set my domain as Micro SaaS. First, I share the Micro SaaS pictures that I create every day on Twitter. I create the pictures myself. I've been posting for a week.

I have a Micro SaaS-focused blog. I am sharing my knowledge. Because I had previously installed Micro SaaS. I aim to build 4-5 Micro SaaS in 2023. I might even sell it on Micro Acquire.

Regardless, the main issue is the loyal audience that buys. Do you think the path I'm on is the right one? Do you have any extra suggestions for this trip? Thank you.

Ask HN: Where do you store secrets you can’t easily change if exposed
text:
I’m using/leaving LastPass and following the vault exposure working my way through 100s of password changes. I realised when doing this that I have a bunch of stuff in LP that isn’t so easy to change such as bank card details, word sets to recover access to 2FA protected accounts, SSH keys and passphrases, root passwords etc

What are others using to store these types of secrets?

I’m moving to Bitwarden and although it may support secure notes I’d be interested to hear what others are doing.
